title: How is Nestorian Christianity different from Orthodox Christianity? - Quora

response.answer_text: The personhood of Christ. For the Nestorians, Christ’s human nature and divine natures are divided and in Orthodox Christianity Christ’s human and divine natures are united since he is one person. So in Orthodox Christianity Mary is given the title Mother of God or Theotokos because she bore Chist in her womb and gave birth to him and Christ is God. For the Nestorians she is called the Mother of Christ, Christotokos since somehow Christ’s human nature is one person and his divine nature is another
While the churches originally divided over Christology, recent discussions have demonstrated that the churches share a common faith. Their liturgies are similar in outline but may differ in detail.
